intro: Saccolabium acaule, commonly known as the naked-stem saccolabium, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its herbaceous growth habit. The plant typically features a short, often inconspicuous stem and clusters of small, pea-like flowers. Its leaves are usually compound, with several pairs of small, oval-shaped leaflets. Saccolabium acaule is adapted to arid environments and is often found in sandy or rocky soils.
